column4: In Arch, gnome 2.24's session-manger isn't working. Moreover, when I click log out, all the apps are simply killed and not properly shut down. Is this a problem in ubuntu 8.10 as well? (if it is, I'll stay at 8.04.1)
how are you determining the apps are not properly shut down?
how are you determining the apps are not properly shut down?
well, none of them saves their settings; firefox starts up with the crash-handler after logging in, xchat I had to quit manually otherwise I had to enter the favchannels etc everytime
let me log out with firefox, one sec
note, this is in archlinux, NOT ubuntu. but I really hate that so if it is the same in ubuntu 8.10 and gnome 2.24 there I'll just stay at 8.04 and gnome 2.22

yep, firefox says it was closed unexpectedly.  This is probably related as to why I can't get my sessions to save too.  I remember reading a bug on launchpad that pointed upstream regarding gnome-session and the inability to save sessions
yes, this is correct. gnome is basically released with 2 horrible, showstopper bugs IMO.

I couldn't save the sessions in gnome 2.24/archlinux either, another major showstopper. I was planing to use gnome in between kde 4.2 but I think I'll either go to kde again or try something else :) I need a sessionmanager and not to mention the ability to close programs like they should.
this gives me a good excuse to try hibernate though
hehe yeah.. I'll have to check that out myself. Really strange though, such a serious bug, makes ubuntu 8.10 a step backwards for me
if nothing else, it also gives me a good excuse to check out alternative de/wm's :)
